Costco is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Costco is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or any other legally protected status. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request to IT-Recruiting@costco.com

If hired, you will be required to provide proof of authorization to work in the United States. Applicants and employees for this position will not be sponsored for work authorization, including, but not limited to H1-B visas .

Title: Field Operations Analyst
Description:
Nintendo of America Inc.

About Nintendo of America: From the launch of the Nintendo Entertainment System™ more than 30 years ago, Nintendo’s mission has been to create smiles through unique entertainment experiences. Here at Nintendo of America Inc., we deliver on this mission by partnering closely with Nintendo Co., Ltd., to bring Nintendo’s iconic and cherished franchises including Mario™, Donkey Kong™, The Legend of Zelda™, Metroid™, Animal Crossing™, Pikmin™ and Splatoon™ across the Americas through our video games, hardware systems, and collaborations with partners on a range of other entertainment initiatives like feature films and theme parks.

Based in Redmond, Wash., Nintendo of America serves as headquarters for Nintendo’s operations in the Americas. We are an equal opportunity employer offering a welcoming and inclusive environment in service to one another, our products, and the diverse consumers and communities we call home. For more information about Nintendo, please visit the company’s website at https://www.nintendo.com/.

SUMMARY: Collaborates cross-functionally to perform general field operations and project readiness for US & Canada. Publishes business intelligence reports and insights. Responsible for technology, content, and health of all physical retail displays.

Description Of Duties


Provides reporting on the business intelligence (BI) metrics and trends for merchandising initiatives and project needs.
Develops and publishes quantitative and qualitative reports related to sales, health and performance of displays, consumer engagement, store visits, and trends to provide business insights to stakeholders.
Leverages dashboards and technology created by IT to manage data going into and out of the interactives used for reporting on KPI data and ensuring proper content is available.
Ensures timely content updates, graphic updates, and maintenance of interactives and in-store displays.
Contributes to definition and establishment of protocols and standards for field communication, display issue escalation, and project execution and compliance.
Oversees technology inventory (hardware, software and accessories) and assists with recommendations on field technology purchases, installation schedules, etc.
Works cross-functionally to plan projects and make recommendations on content, materials, labor, etc. based on business objectives, budgets and reporting results.
Oversees and monitors assigned product launch activities, materials, and resources related to in-store campaigns or permanent merchandising.


Summary Of Requirements


Three to Five years of related business experience.
Experience in a marketing or technology environment preferred.
Strong PC skills (Word, Excel, Access and PowerPoint preferred).
Growth mindset and willingness to learn new technologies and systems.
Retail experience preferred.
Undergraduate degree in Marketing, Advertising or a related field, or equivalent.


Applicants must be legally eligible to work in the United States to be considered. Visa sponsorship is not available for this role.

This position is hybrid in Redmond, WA. Hybrid positions require regular onsite work following the schedule and guidelines for their division. This position is not open to fully remote status at this time.

This position includes a base salary range of $77,500- $124,000 annually, potential for a semi-annual discretionary performance bonus, and a comprehensive benefits package that includes medical, dental, vision, 401(k), and paid time off. Please see our Benefits & Perks page for more benefits information.

Title: Data Analyst, Global Tax Services
Description:
Description

Join Amazon’s Tax Team as a Data Analyst for APAC compliance.

Are you a dynamic Business Analyst with a passion for tax technology? Are you proficient with Data Analysis tools such as SQL? Amazon's Global Tax Services Team is seeking an enthusiastic individual eager to navigate new territories, learn rapidly, and handle confidential information with the utmost integrity.

You're the ideal fit if you possess a blend of data proficiency, solution design skills, and a solid grasp of tax or accounting principles. Your ability to make informed judgments and adapt in a fast-paced environment sets you apart. As a self-starter, you excel in driving initiatives and thrive in a results-driven setting.

Key job responsibilities

In this role, you'll have a diverse range of responsibilities, including:


Design and Delivery: Contribute to the design and implementation of scalable tax technology solutions.
Data Analysis: Conduct in-depth research and analysis of tax reporting data for specific tax jurisdictions, addressing data quality issues, and defining functional requirements for technical development.
Process Improvement: Collaborate with tax teams to enhance efficiency and controller-ship in current processes, educating them on data acquisition for reporting, planning, and controller-ship.
Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, fostering relationships with the tax, business and engineering teams across Amazon.
Metrics Development: Support the creation of new metrics to quantify the value of various aspects of tax data.


Basic Qualifications


3+ years of tax, finance or a related analytical field experience
5+ years of Excel (including VBA, pivot tables, array functions, power pivots, etc.) and data visualization tools such as Tableau experience
Bachelor's degree or equivalent
Experience defining requirements and using data and metrics to draw business insights
Experience with Excel
Experience with SQL
Experience making business recommendations and influencing stakeholders
2+ years of experience designing and building Alteryx workflows.


Preferred Qualifications


Experience in business or financial analysis
Proficiency in written communication and ability to produce high-caliber documentation


Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $66,900/year in our lowest geographic market up to $143,100/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. For more information, please visit https://www.aboutamazon.com/workplace/employee-benefits. This position will remain posted until filled. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site.

  • Metrics Development: Support the creation of new metrics to quantify the value of various aspects of tax data.

Basic Qualifications

  • 3+ years of tax, finance or a related analytical field experience
  • 5+ years of Excel (including VBA, pivot tables, array functions, power pivots, etc.) and data visualization tools such as Tableau experience
  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent
  • Experience defining requirements and using data and metrics to draw business insights
  • Experience with Excel
  • Experience with SQL
  • Experience making business recommendations and influencing stakeholders
  • 2+ years of experience designing and building Alteryx workflows.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience in business or financial analysis
  • Proficiency in written communication and ability to produce high-caliber documentation

Company - Amazon.com Services LLC

Job ID: A2804171

Title: Business Analyst, Listing Analytics
Description:
Description

Are you looking for a role that allows you to shape the future of how sellers sell their products globally with Amazon? Do you like working in a start-up like environment with the opportunity to have a significant impact from day 1? Do you have an insatiable curiosity about why Amazon global stores operate as they do and how Amazon could optimize its global selling business? If so, then keep reading as this could be the role for you.

Over 2MM active sellers in 22 countries (and growing) list their products for sale on the Amazon stores. Sellers are a critical part of Amazon’s ecosystem to deliver on our vision of offering the earth’s largest selection and lowest prices.

Key job responsibilities

About

As a Business Analyst on Listing Analytics team, you will be responsible for bringing data to the table, specifically seller anecdotes and business metrics. The ideal candidate thrives in working in large and complex data warehouse environments, has excellent verbal and written communication skills, is motivated by developing innovative and simplified solutions to solve complex analytical problems and is passionate about working with large data sets and bringing data together to answer business questions and drive change. These analyses and solutions will be fundamental to finding opportunities and creating new programs aimed at further growing on Amazon stores. In this role you will:


Engage with leadership and diversified customer groups to understand the needs and recommend business intelligence solutions.
Partner with engineering teams to define the data elements and data structures that the team should leverage to develop critical seller experience metrics.
Design, implement, and support platforms that provide business teams ad-hoc access to large datasets for self service deep dives (eg: data visualization tools for non-tech business users)
Interface with business customers, gather requirements and deliver complete reporting solutions.
Own the design, development, and maintenance of ongoing metrics, reports, analyses, dashboards, etc. to drive key business decisions.
Participate in strategic & tactical planning discussions
Standardize data and report consumption across all customer groups.
Make recommendations for new metrics, techniques, and strategies to improve the operational and quality metrics.
Be connected and influential within the Amazon analytics community. Work with business intelligence engineer, data engineering, software development teams to enable the appropriate capture and storage of key data points.


Basic Qualifications


3+ years of tax, finance or a related analytical field experience
5+ years of Excel (including VBA, pivot tables, array functions, power pivots, etc.) and data visualization tools such as Tableau experience
3+ years of business or financial analysis experience
Bachelor's degree or equivalent
Experience defining requirements and using data and metrics to draw business insights
Experience with Excel
Experience with SQL
Experience making business recommendations and influencing stakeholders


Preferred Qualifications


Experience with data visualization using Tableau, Quicksight, or similar tools
Master's degree in business or analytical discipline
Experience in data mining, ETL, etc. and using databases in a business environment with large-scale, complex datasets

Company - Amazon.com Services LLC

Job ID: A2899831

Title: Lead Data Analyst, Operations & Fulfillment
Description:
Hims & Hers Health, Inc. (better known as Hims & Hers) is the leading health and wellness platform, on a mission to help the world feel great through the power of better health. We are revolutionizing telehealth for providers and their patients alike. Making personalized solutions accessible is of paramount importance to Hims & Hers and we are focused on continued innovation in this space. Hims & Hers offers nonprescription products and access to highly personalized prescription solutions for a variety of conditions related to mental health, sexual health, hair care, skincare, heart health, and more.




Hims & Hers is a public company, traded on the NYSE under the ticker symbol “HIMS”. To learn more about the brand and offerings, you can visit hims.com and forhers.com, or visit our investor site. For information on the company’s outstanding benefits, culture, and its talent-first flexible/remote work approach, see below and visit www.hims.com/careers-professionals.




About The Role

As a Lead Data Analyst for Operations Analytics, you will act as a strategic leader in leveraging analytics to drive efficiency, scalability, and innovation across Hims & Hers’ operational functions. You will own the design, execution, and delivery of advanced analytics projects, partnering with cross-functional teams to uncover insights and deliver actionable recommendations. Your expertise in operational data and storytelling will be critical in shaping business strategies and fostering data-driven decision-making at scale.




This lead-level role will involve close collaboration with teams spanning Dispense & Fulfillment, Operations Assurance, Planning & Optimization, Compounding, Supply Chain, and Operations Finance. Reporting to the Senior Manager of Operations Analytics, you’ll operate in a fully remote and highly collaborative environment that values curiosity, growth, and innovation.




You Will:

Mentor junior analysts and assist in building a high-performance team of analysts capable of gathering, synthesizing, and analyzing data quickly and accurately
Design and implement scalable platforms and processes to enable data-driven decisions across multiple business lines, modalities, and treatment types
Tackle complex problems by determining proper analytical methodologies, deriving actionable insights, and presenting conclusions to cross-functional stakeholders
Establish and measure key performance indicators (KPIs) that align with throughput and business outcomes, enabling precise performance tracking
Identify growth and operational optimization opportunities by structuring and executing experiments in collaboration with cross-functional teams; drive knowledge-sharing and adoption of findings across the organization
Proactively initiate and advocate for bold, high-impact strategic opportunities derived from the team’s analytics work, influencing executive-level decisions
Leverage internal and external data to uncover growth opportunities, providing actionable, data-driven recommendations for business expansion
Partner with teams across Data Engineering, Operations, and Finance to define, build, and execute a data-informed business strategy and operational roadmaps
Lead the creation of high-quality dashboards, reports, and insights tailored for executive-level consumption, driving informed decision-making at all levels




You Have:

8-10 years of experience in data engineering, business intelligence, operations, or analytics, with a focus on fulfillment and operational excellence
Advanced proficiency in SQL, with intermediate-to-advanced experience in R or Python for data analysis and automation
Hands-on experience with tools like Looker, Google BigQuery, and DBT, with the ability to design scalable analytics solutions
Exceptional ability to design and execute complex analysis projects, including statistical analysis and process optimization
Superb written and verbal communication skills, with experience presenting insights and recommendations to senior, cross-functional stakeholders
Strong ability to contextualize data and insights within the business landscape, effectively communicating findings to both technical and non-technical teammates
Proven ability to thrive in fast-paced, high-growth, and rapidly changing environments, delivering results under pressure




Preferred:

Advanced degree (MS) in Mathematics, Statistics, Data Analytics, or a related field
Familiarity with healthcare data, including compliance with HIPAA/PHI, or experience with two-sided marketplace data
Demonstrated ability to challenge conventional approaches and drive innovative, high-impact decisions
Knowledge of operational KPIs and best practices across fulfillment, logistics, supply chain, and customer service
Proficient understanding of statistical analysis, data science concepts, experimentation and how to implement that knowledge into the functional areas within Operations
Experience working with DBT and implementing best practices with modeling data




Benefits (there Are More But Here Are Some Highlights):

Competitive salary & equity compensation for full-time roles
Unlimited PTO, company holidays, and quarterly mental health days
Comprehensive health benefits including medical, dental & vision, and parental leave
Employee Stock Purchase Program (ESPP)
Employee discounts on hims & hers & Apostrophe online products
401k benefits with employer matching contribution
Offsite team retreats




Outlined below is a reasonable estimate of H&H’s compensation range for this role for US-based candidates. If you're based outside of the US, your recruiter will be able to provide you with an estimated salary range for your location.




The actual amount will take into account a range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions, including but not limited to skill sets, experience and training, licensure and certifications, and location. H&H also offers a comprehensive Total Rewards package that may include an equity grant.




Consult with your Recruiter during any potential screening to determine a more targeted range based on location and job-related factors.




An estimate of the current salary range is

$155,000—$190,000 USD




We are focused on building a diverse and inclusive workforce. If you’re excited about this role, but do not meet 100% of the qualifications listed above, we encourage you to apply.




Hims considers all qualified applicants for employment, including applicants with arrest or conviction records, in accordance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, the Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance, the California Fair Chance Act, and any similar state or local fair chance laws.




It is unlawful in Massachusetts to require or administer a lie detector test as a condition of employment or continued employment. An employer who violates this law shall be subject to criminal penalties and civil liability.




Hims & Hers is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please contact us at accommodations@forhims.com and describe the needed accommodation. Your privacy is important to us, and any information you share will only be used for the legitimate purpose of considering your request for accommodation. Hims & Hers gives consideration to all qualified applicants without regard to any protected status, including disability. Please do not send resumes to this email address.




To learn more about how we collect, use, retain, and disclose Personal Information, please visit our Global Candidate Privacy Statement.

Title: Data Quality and System Analyst I
Description:
Do you enjoy analyzing data, solving problems, and improving data quality and system performance to enhance the provider experience? We are seeking a Data Quality and System Analyst I to support system analysis, design, and optimization while developing and implementing data validation and cleansing processes to ensure accuracy and integrity—all with the goal of driving operational efficiency.

At Delta Dental of Washington our vision is that all people can enjoy good oral and overall health, with no one left behind. We succeed because of a shared commitment to a set of values that guide everything we do – for our customers, for our communities, and for each other. We are Accountable. We lean in with Courage. We stay Curious. We are Inclusive. We act with Integrity.

We offer a highly competitive medical, dental and vision plans as well offering a generous 401k match and all employees start accruing vacation and sick time from their very first day. We empower employee development through our tuition reimbursement plan, professional development plans, and employee-led communities.

The pay range for this position In Western Washington varies between $52,140.00 – $72,930.00, and for Eastern Washington varies between $49,686.00 – $69,497.00. Washington Dental Service and its affiliates, including Delta Dental of Washington, Arcora Foundation, and TriForza intends to offer the selected candidate a base pay within this range, dependent on job-related, non-discriminatory factors such as experience. Base pay will also be adjusted based on the candidate's geographic location.

Essential Responsibilities include the following: The list of responsibilities listed is not intended to be comprehensive. Washington Dental Service and its affiliates, including Arcora Foundation, Delta Dental of Washington, and TriForza reserve the right to change the responsibilities at any time with or without notice.


Capture business requirements to support system design, testing, and deployment.
Perform data validation and analysis to support decision-making, ensuring accuracy and integrity through cleansing processes.
Conduct in-depth analysis of datasets to proactively identify inconsistencies, eliminate duplicates, resolve missing values, and detect systemic data errors that impact business operations.
Support the management of the provider data lifecycle, ensuring data quality, traceability, and the resolution of inconsistencies.
Identify, troubleshoot, and resolve system-related issues, conducting root cause analysis and recommending improvements.
Develop system specifications, flow diagrams, and documentation for business and technical teams.
Support system integration, user acceptance testing (UAT), audits, and corrective actions to maintain data quality and functionality.
Continuously enhance understanding of key applications and collaborate to ensure seamless system implementation and performance.
Maintain detailed records of data sources, transformations, and access points to ensure traceability and clarity.
Analyze data to determine modifications needed to procedures, processes, and practices.
Translate technical concepts for diverse audiences, train staff on data standard processes and system use.
Serve as a National Provider File (NPF) backup coordinator to ensure our provider data is accurate and compliant with all DDPA standards.



Experience, skills, and education do you need to have to succeed in the position: The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required to successfully perform the essential functions of the position.


At least 2 years of experience working with provider, member, or clinical information, preferably in a healthcare or insurance environment.
Experience in documenting user stories and capturing business requirements, collaborating with teams to drive system enhancements and process improvements.
Skilled in identifying, analyzing, and resolving data quality issues and system inefficiencies to enhance accuracy and reliability.
Experience with or a strong desire to learn data analysis and visualization tools, including SQL Server Management Studio (SSMS), SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS), Snowflake, Tableau, Excel, and SQL.
Exceptional attention to detail, with the ability to maintain data accuracy, integrity, and compliance with industry standards.
Solid project management skills to effectively balance multiple priorities and drive efficiency in fast-paced environments.
Proactive problem-solver with a growth mindset, eager to learn and adapt to new systems, tools, and emerging technologies.
Experience with documentation and process mapping tools.
Familiarity with Dental on Demand (DoD) is preferred.



Washington Dental Service and its affiliates, including Arcora Foundation, Delta Dental of Washington, and TriForza are Equal Opportunity employers. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.

Title: Analyst – Business Intelligence II
Description:
Application Close Date

Applications will be accepted on an ongoing basis until the requisition is closed.

At Blue Origin, we envision millions of people living and working in space for the benefit of Earth. We’re working to develop reusable, safe, and low-cost space vehicles and systems within a culture of safety, collaboration, and inclusion. Join our diverse team of problem solvers as we add new chapters to the history of spaceflight! 

We are seeking a detail-oriented and data driven Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst II. to join our team within the Business Operations Organization. In this role, you will combine critical thinking, problem-solving, and technical expertise to transform raw data into measurable and actionable reports that enable various operational teams to optimize processes, improve performance, and operate with precision and efficiency. Collaborating with cross functional teams, you will design and maintain advanced data models, dashboards, analyze key trends, and provide recommendations that drive measurable improvements across the Operations Organization. This role requires domain expertise in manufacturing and ideally aerospace, who proactively understands the “why” behind the data and use that to design solutions that optimize processes and foster organizational success.

This role is central to data-driven decisions and fostering operational efficiency. We are looking for someone who not only meets technical qualifications but also exhibits the intellectual curiosity and problem-solving mindset needed to elevate the organization to new levels of performance.

Special Mentions


Relocation Provided.
Location: Any of the major manufacturing sites (WA, FL, or AL) preferred.


Responsibilities Include But Not Limited To


Analyze data to thoroughly understand processes, trends, and opportunities, ensuring all findings are actionable and aligned with business goals
Design and implement advanced data visualizations and dashboards that not only present information but actively influence and drive the right behaviors across operational teams
Collaborate with business and operations teams to identify pain points, uncover inefficiencies, and develop metrics that promote operational excellence
Perform detailed data analysis and validation to ensure accuracy and reliability
Take a proactive approach to problem-solving, anticipating challenges, and offering innovative, data-driven solutions
Communicate findings clearly and effectively, ensuring stakeholders understand the insights and their implications for process improvements


Minimum Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree in data science, Computer Science, or related field.
2+ years of experience in business intelligence, data analytics, or a related role.
Expertise in SQL, data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, PowerBI).
Proficiency in data analysis tools and languages (e.g. Python, SQL).
Familiarity with big data platforms, and cloud technologies.
3+ years of experience in manufacturing, operations, and/or supply chain analytics.
Proven critical thinking and problem-solving skills, with the ability to approach challenges from multiple angles and deliver impactful solutions.
Strong attention to detail, ensuring that recommendations are accurate, meaningful, and actionable.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to explain complex data concepts to technical and non-technical stakeholders.
A mindset of ownership and curiosity, actively seeking to understand data and its broader business context.
Must be a U.S. citizen or national, U.S. permanent resident (current Green Card holder), or lawfully admitted into the U.S. as a refugee or granted asylum.


Preferred Qualifications


Experience in Aerospace Manufacturing.
Experience with data from Costpoint, Workday, and Cornerstone.


Compensation Range For

CA applicants is $96,310.00-$134,833.65;CO applicants is $88,284.00-$123,597.60;WA applicants is $96,310.00-$134,833.65

Other Site Ranges May Differ

Inclusivity Statement

Don’t meet all desired requirements? Studies have shown that some people are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single desired qualification. At Blue Origin, we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every desired qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

Export Control Regulations

Applicants for employment at Blue Origin must be a U.S. citizen or national, U.S. permanent resident (i.e. current Green Card holder), or lawfully admitted into the U.S. as a refugee or granted asylum.

Background Check


Required for all positions: Blue’s Standard Background Check
Required for Certain Job Profiles: Defense Biometric Identification System (DIBDS) background check if at any time the role requires one to be on a military installation
Required for Certain Job Profiles: Drivers who operate Commercial Motor Vehicles with a Gross Vehicle Weight (GVW), Gross Vehicle Weight Rating (GVWR) or combination of power unit and trailer that meets or exceeds 10,001 lbs. and/or transports placardable amounts of hazardous materials by ground in any vehicle on a public road while in commerce, may be subject to additional Federal Motor Carrier Safety Regulations including: Driver Qualification Files, Medical Certification, Road Test, Hours of Service, Drug and Alcohol Testing (CDL drivers only), vehicle inspection requirements, CDL requirements (if applicable) and hazardous materials transportation/shipping training.


Benefits


Benefits include: Medical, dental, vision, basic and supplemental life insurance, paid parental leave, short and long-term disability, 401(k) with a company match of up to 5%, and an Education Support Program.
Paid Time Off: Up to four (4) weeks per year based on weekly scheduled hours, and up to 14 company-paid holidays.
Discretionary bonus: Bonuses are designed to reward individual contributions as well as allow employees to share in company results.
Eligibility for benefits varies by role type, please check with your recruiter for a comprehensive list of the benefits available for this role.

Blue Origin hires and promotes people on the basis of their qualifications, performance, and abilities. Title: Business Analyst, SPS Finance Insights & Analytics
Description:
Description

Amazon Selling Partner Support’s Command Center is Amazon’s central defense against large-scale, Selling Partner-impacting incidents as well as driving operational excellence across the Selling Partner Operations organization.


Work alongside Program Managers to develop solutions that are applicable at a global level in the form of automated reports, dashboards or tools.
Answer operational questions based on the data and models for the weekly/monthly/quarterly business reviews.
Analyze and solve business problems with focus on understanding root causes and driving forward-looking opportunities.
Establish relationship between output metric and its drivers in order to identify critical drivers and control the critical drivers so as to achieve the desired value of output metric.
Simplify and reduce the manual work by automating analysis through SQL, Scripts (Python or R) and providing outputs to internal customers in friendly formats (e.g. Tableau)
Define parameters and success criteria for live tests to confirm/deny hypothesis in models.
Design, implement, and support platforms that provide ad-hoc access to large datasets.
Work with other support teams to scale projects, improve methodologies and use resources efficiently.


About The Team

We strive to make Amazon the best way for Partners to reach customers locally and globally and to operate their businesses, driven by the accurate and efficient support and solutions we provide them. PSAS focuses on both preventing Selling Partner (Seller, Vendor and Brand Registry) contacts based on knowledge obtained during our support interactions, and for handling those contacts with quality and efficiency. To achieve this vision, we make daily adjustments throughout our global network to meet the needs of our Selling Partners, employees, and the business. We invest in technology to eliminate the root cause defects that cause Selling Partners to seek help, build self-service tools to resolve their issues on their own without waiting for help from Amazon, and provide Associates with the tools that automate clerical steps and provide consistent, efficient, quality resolution. Our team includes product managers, program managers, SDEs, scientists, and a range of operational and other specialty roles, and we operate at scale with over 17K Amazonians in our team, spanning 56 global locations, and handling over 50M contacts a year.

Basic Qualifications


Bachelor's degree or higher in a quantitative/technical field (e.g. Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering) , or equivalent work experience.
3+ years of relevant experience in one of the following areas: business intelligence or data analytics.
Experience with SQL using databases like MySQL, Redshift or similar.
Experience in data visualization tools using Excel, Tableau, QuickSight, Power BI or similar.
High attention to detail and proven ability to manage multiple priorities simultaneously.
Excellent data presentation skills and demonstrated ability to successfully partner with business and technical teams.
Ability to operate successfully and independently in a fast-paced environment.
Be comfortable with ambiguity and curious to learn new skills.
You are fluent in English.


Preferred Qualifications


Masters’ degree in Math, Operations Research, Statistics or related discipline.
5+ years' experience as a Data / Business Analyst/ Business Intelligence.
Experience and ability to effectively gather information from multiple data sources.
Experience in scripting languages such as Python, R, Bash or similar languages with applications for data analysis.
History of applying statistical or machine learning models to business problems.


Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $66,900/year in our lowest geographic market up to $143,100/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. For more information, please visit https://www.aboutamazon.com/workplace/employee-benefits. This position will remain posted until filled. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site.

Company - Amazon.com Services LLC

Job ID: A2926167

Title: Data Analyst, Global Tax Services, Amazon Tax
Description:
Description

Join Amazon’s Tax Team as a Data Analyst for LATAM compliance.

Are you a dynamic Business Analyst with a passion for tax technology? Are you proficient with Data Analysis tools such as SQL? Amazon's Global Tax Services Team is seeking an enthusiastic individual eager to navigate new territories, learn rapidly, and handle confidential information with the utmost integrity.

You're the ideal fit if you possess a blend of data proficiency, solution design skills, and a solid grasp of tax or accounting principles. Your ability to make informed judgments and adapt in a fast-paced environment sets you apart. As a self-starter, you excel in driving initiatives and thrive in a results-driven setting.

Key job responsibilities

In this role, you'll have a diverse range of responsibilities, including:


Design and Delivery: Contribute to the design and implementation of scalable tax technology solutions.
Data Analysis: Conduct in-depth research and analysis of tax reporting data for specific tax jurisdictions, addressing data quality issues, and defining functional requirements for technical development.
Process Improvement: Collaborate with tax teams to enhance efficiency and controller-ship in current processes, educating them on data acquisition for reporting, planning, and controller-ship.
Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, fostering relationships with the tax, business and engineering teams across Amazon.
Metrics Development: Support the creation of new metrics to quantify the value of various aspects of tax data.


Basic Qualifications


3+ years of tax, finance or a related analytical field experience
5+ years of Excel (including VBA, pivot tables, array functions, power pivots, etc.) and data visualization tools such as Tableau experience
3+ years of business or financial analysis experience
Bachelor's degree or equivalent
Experience defining requirements and using data and metrics to draw business insights
Experience with SQL
Experience making business recommendations and influencing stakeholders


Preferred Qualifications


Experience in business or financial analysis
Proficiency in written communication and ability to produce high-caliber documentation

Company - Amazon.com Services LLC

Job ID: A2846770

Title: Business Analyst II, Centralized Analytics and Data Engineering
Description:
Description

As a Business Analyst, from Day 1, you will be challenged with a variety of tasks, ranging from creating datasets, reports and dashboards to metadata modeling, pipeline monitoring, and more.

What are we looking for?


You are passionate about finding root causes, trends, and patterns and how they impact business. You use data to support your ideas and drive actionable outcomes, and draw inferences and conclusions based on data.
You have extensive experience working with extremely large data sets and are comfortable with various tools and technologies to consume, extract and transform data.
You have experience in creating dashboards and visualizations of processed data, identifying trends & anomalies, and providing unique ways to present data and information in an easy to consume format.
You have business communication skills to be able to work with product owners to understand key business questions, and are able to build solutions (reports / dashboards) that enable product owners to answer those questions quickly and accurately.
You are comfortable handling competing priorities and ambiguity. You thrive in an agile and fast-paced environment on highly visible projects and initiatives.


Key job responsibilities

Key job responsibilities


You will transform data into actionable business information, and will make it readily accessible to stakeholders worldwide.
You will help translate analytic insights into concrete, actionable recommendations for business or product improvement.
You will develop dashboards that provide insights into the health and state of the business, create analytics solutions to drive deep dives, and determine ways to measure impact.
You will provide insights and analytical solutions to help drive operational efficiencies, uncover the hidden risks and trends, reduce investigation errors, improve customer experience and predict & recommend the optimizations for future state.
You will interact with internal program and product owners, and technical teams to gather requirements, structure scalable and perform data solutions, and gain a deep understanding of key datasets.
You will own the design, creation, and management of extremely large datasets.
You will be responsible to tune query performance against large and complex data sets.
You will design, implement and drive adoption of new analytic technologies and solutions and promote industry standard best practices.


About The Team

About the team

The Centralized Analytics and Data Engineering (CADE) team is a part of Amazon's Selling Partner Services' (SPS) Trustworthy Shopping Experience org. The team provides analytics and data engineering for organizations such as Brand Registry and Reporter experience, IP Protection and Perfect Order Experience. The team also develops BI tools to automate insight generation and data handling process.

Basic Qualifications


3+ years of tax, finance or a related analytical field experience
3+ years of Excel (including VBA, pivot tables, array functions, power pivots, etc.) and data visualization tools such as Tableau experience
Experience defining requirements and using data and metrics to draw business insights
Bachelor's degree or equivalent
Experience making business recommendations and influencing stakeholders


Preferred Qualifications


5+ years of Excel (including VBA, pivot tables, array functions, power pivots, etc.) and data visualization tools such as Tableau experience
4+ years of business analyst, data analyst or similar role experience
Experience with data visualization using Tableau, Quicksight, or similar tools
Experience with SQL

Company - Amazon.com Services LLC

Job ID: A2899972
Show more
HTML:
Description

As a Business Analyst, from Day 1, you will be challenged with a variety of tasks, ranging from creating datasets, reports and dashboards to metadata modeling, pipeline monitoring, and more.

What are we looking for?

  • You are passionate about finding root causes, trends, and patterns and how they impact business. You use data to support your ideas and drive actionable outcomes, and draw inferences and conclusions based on data.
  • You have extensive experience working with extremely large data sets and are comfortable with various tools and technologies to consume, extract and transform data.
  • You have experience in creating dashboards and visualizations of processed data, identifying trends & anomalies, and providing unique ways to present data and information in an easy to consume format.
  • You have business communication skills to be able to work with product owners to understand key business questions, and are able to build solutions (reports / dashboards) that enable product owners to answer those questions quickly and accurately.
  • You are comfortable handling competing priorities and ambiguity. You thrive in an agile and fast-paced environment on highly visible projects and initiatives.

Key job responsibilities

Key job responsibilities

  • You will transform data into actionable business information, and will make it readily accessible to stakeholders worldwide.
  • You will help translate analytic insights into concrete, actionable recommendations for business or product improvement.
  • You will develop dashboards that provide insights into the health and state of the business, create analytics solutions to drive deep dives, and determine ways to measure impact.
  • You will provide insights and analytical solutions to help drive operational efficiencies, uncover the hidden risks and trends, reduce investigation errors, improve customer experience and predict & recommend the optimizations for future state.
  • You will interact with internal program and product owners, and technical teams to gather requirements, structure scalable and perform data solutions, and gain a deep understanding of key datasets.
  • You will own the design, creation, and management of extremely large datasets.
  • You will be responsible to tune query performance against large and complex data sets.
  • You will design, implement and drive adoption of new analytic technologies and solutions and promote industry standard best practices.

About The Team

About the team

The Centralized Analytics and Data Engineering (CADE) team is a part of Amazon's Selling Partner Services' (SPS) Trustworthy Shopping Experience org. The team provides analytics and data engineering for organizations such as Brand Registry and Reporter experience, IP Protection and Perfect Order Experience. The team also develops BI tools to automate insight generation and data handling process.

Basic Qualifications

  • 3+ years of tax, finance or a related analytical field experience
  • 3+ years of Excel (including VBA, pivot tables, array functions, power pivots, etc.) and data visualization tools such as Tableau experience
  • Experience defining requirements and using data and metrics to draw business insights
  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent
  • Experience making business recommendations and influencing stakeholders

Preferred Qualifications

  • 5+ years of Excel (including VBA, pivot tables, array functions, power pivots, etc.) and data visualization tools such as Tableau experience
  • 4+ years of business analyst, data analyst or similar role experience
  • Experience with data visualization using Tableau, Quicksight, or similar tools
  • Experience with SQL

Company - Amazon.com Services LLC

Job ID: A2899972

Title: Business Analyst III, SWA Data & Analytics, SWA Data & Analytics
Description:
Description

At Amazon, we're working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. Amazon is seeking a Business Analyst to drive large scale projects, programs, and technical initiatives. In this role, you will be responsible for converting data into actionable business insights. The ideal candidate is an analysis expert who leverages a variety of data platforms and analytical tools to provide timely, meaningful, and consumable information. They build deep contextual and domain knowledge, and ensure data quality and build scalable tools. They communicate findings with the most effective and influential methods.

As a Business Analyst, you will be responsible for supporting the long-term planning. This role will be responsible for partnering with multiple stakeholders to forecast the business needs for the next 3 years. A critical part of this role is to develop stable models and to be able to take the stabilized models to the next level from an automation standpoint. This role requires exceptional communication and interpersonal skills with Operations, Finance, Recruiting, and HR stakeholders in a high-pressure environment. You will manage a high-visibility program and partner with all levels of leadership to exercise sound judgment where clear guidelines may not exist

Key job responsibilities


Own the development and maintenance of new and existing solution artifacts which are focused on driving efficiency within the business via analysis, metrics and reporting dashboards
Partner with operations/business teams to consult, develop and implement KPI's, automated reporting/process solutions, and process improvements to meet business needs.
Enable effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into a digestible and actionable format.
Prepare and deliver business requirements reviews to the senior management team regarding progress and roadblocks.
Participate in strategic and tactical planning discussions.
Design, develop and maintain scaled, automated, user-friendly systems, reports, dashboards, etc. that will support our business needs.
Travel 10% each quarter at max.


Basic Qualifications


5+ years of tax, finance or a related analytical field experience
3+ years of writing SQL queries and creating business intelligence reports using Tableau, Power BI experience
Bachelor's degree
Experience defining requirements and using data and metrics to draw business insights
Experience with Excel
Experience with SQL
Experience making business recommendations and influencing stakeholders


Preferred Qualifications


MBA

Company - Amazon.com Services LLC

Job ID: A2878875

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
About Ascendion :

Ascendion is a full-service digital engineering solutions company. We make and manage software platforms and products that power growth and deliver captivating experiences to consumers and employees. Our engineering, cloud, data, experience design, and talent solution capabilities accelerate transformation and impact for enterprise clients. Headquartered in New Jersey, our workforce of 6,000+ Ascenders delivers solutions from around the globe. Ascendion is built differently to engineer the next.




Ascendion | Engineering to elevate life

We have a culture built on opportunity, inclusion, and a spirit of partnership. Come, change the world with us:

Build the coolest tech for world’s leading brands
Solve complex problems – and learn new skills
Experience the power of transforming digital engineering for Fortune 500 clients
Master your craft with leading training programs and hands-on experience

Experience a community of change makers!

Join a culture of high-performing innovators with endless ideas and a passion for tech. Our culture is the fabric of our company, and it is what makes us unique and diverse. The way we share ideas, learning, experiences, successes, and joy allows everyone to be their best at Ascendion.

About the Role:

Job Title: Data Engineer

Job Description:

Key Responsibilities:

Develop, optimize, and maintain ETL pipelines using AWS Glue.
Build and manage data workflows and orchestration using Managed Airflow (MWAA).
Write and optimize SQL and Python/PySpark scripts for data transformation and processing.
Work with data platforms such as Redshift and S3 for efficient data storage and retrieval.
Implement data cataloging and governance using AWS Glue and Lake Formation.
Support reporting and analytics teams by ensuring data availability for QuickSight and Tableau.
Assist in automating infrastructure deployment using AWS CDK and client Build Tools.
Monitor, troubleshoot, and optimize data pipelines for performance and reliability.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand data requirements and business objectives.

Required Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in computer science, Data Engineering, or a related field.
3-5+ years of experience in data engineering, ETL development, or similar roles.
Proficiency in AWS data technologies, including AWS Glue, Redshift, S3, and Lake Formation.
Strong programming skills in SQL, Python, and PySpark.
Experience with data pipeline orchestration using Managed Airflow (MWAA).
Familiarity with data modeling, warehousing concepts, and performance tuning.
Ability to work in an Agile development environment.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with AWS CDK and client Build Tools for infrastructure automation.
Knowledge of data security, governance, and compliance best practices.
AWS certifications (e.g., AWS Certified Data Analytics, AWS Certified Solutions Architect) are a plus.

Location: Remote

Salary Range: The salary for this position is between $110000- $120000 Annually. Factors which may affect pay within this range may include geography/market, skills, education, experience, and other qualifications of the successful candidate.

Benefits: The Company offers the following benefits for this position, subject to applicable eligibility requirements: [medical insurance] [dental insurance] [vision insurance] [09-10 days/hours of paid time off]

Want to change the world? Let us know.

Tell us about your experiences, education, and ambitions. Bring your knowledge, unique viewpoint, and creativity to the table. Let’s talk!

Title: Senior Data Science and Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Job Description

At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. We’re committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that’s welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.

The Boeing Commercial Airplanes (BCA) Human Resources (HR) organization has an exciting opportunity for a Senior Data Science and Business Intelligence Analyst to join the BCA Human Resources Operations team in Renton, WA or North Charleston, SC. Our team is open to a broad range of experience levels including Level 4 and Level 5 specialists to find the best fit for this position.

The selected candidate will be responsible for advancing our capabilities in diagnostic and predictive analytics to inform business strategy. They will also work on optimizing data flow and collection processes within BCA, specifically in the areas of workforce staffing, planning, and organizational efficiency.

Position Responsibilities:



Develop and maintain strategic partnerships with customers, stakeholders, and peers
Exercise critical thinking and innovative problem solving
Analyze and provide meaningful business intelligence based on data, metrics and trends to influence business strategy and performance
Leverage existing data sources as well as mining for new and better sources to link business objectives with people analytics
Responsible for designing Business Intelligence information models, dashboards, metrics and reports utilizing standard technologies and methodologies that meet business objectives
Assess current technology for best fit, best practices and business expertise to deliver efficient and scalable Business Intelligence solutions to improve business productivity and business outcomes with a high level of quality assurance
Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional and program business requirements
Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using standard technologies
Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability and enhance data driven decisions
Plan, organize, schedule, and execute projects
Create concise visuals to explain complex data science forecasting and predictions



Basic Qualifications (Required Skills/Experience):



5+ years of experience in Business Intelligence/data analytics tools
3+ years of experience in developing solutions to a wide range of complex technical problems, requiring ingenuity and innovation
3+ years of experience using SQL
Experience with database design, data modeling, or object modeling
Experience in developing and maintaining relationships and partnerships with senior executives, customers, stakeholders, peers, and business partners



Preferred Qualifications (Desired Skills/Experience):



Bachelor's degree or higher, or equivalent work or military experience
10+ years of related work experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience
Experience building intuitive and actionable dashboards and data visualizations that drive business decisions
Experience demonstrating innovative solutions
Experience using or applying metrics to measure performance against business priorities to ensure high quality outcomes
Mastery in Excel and Tableau



Drug Free Workplace:

Boeing is a Drug Free Workplace where post offer applicants and employees are subject to testing for marijuana, cocaine, opioids, amphetamines, PCP, and alcohol when criteria is met as outlined in our policies.

Pay & Benefits:

At Boeing, we strive to deliver a Total Rewards package that will attract, engage and retain the top talent. Elements of the Total Rewards package include competitive base pay and variable compensation opportunities.

The Boeing Company also provides eligible employees with an opportunity to enroll in a variety of benefit programs, generally including health insurance, flexible spending accounts, health savings accounts, retirement savings plans, life and disability insurance programs, and a number of programs that provide for both paid and unpaid time away from work.

The specific programs and options available to any given employee may vary depending on eligibility factors such as geographic location, date of hire, and the applicability of collective bargaining agreements.

Pay is based upon candidate experience and qualifications, as well as market and business considerations.

Summary pay range Senior (Level 4): $112,200 - $162,150

Summary pay range Senior (Level 5): $129,200 - $187,450

Applications for this position will be accepted until Mar. 17, 2025

Export Control Requirements: This is not an Export Control position.

Relocation

Relocation assistance is not a negotiable benefit for this position.

Visa Sponsorship

Employer will not sponsor applicants for employment visa status.

Shift

This position is for 1st shift

Equal Opportunity Employer:

Boeing is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, physical or mental disability, genetic factors, military/veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

Ability to work in an Agile development environment.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.




Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with AWS CDK and Build Tools for infrastructure automation.
Knowledge of data security, governance, and compliance best practices.
AWS certifications (e.g., AWS Certified Data Analytics, AWS Certified Solutions Architect) are a plus.




Location: 100% Onsite in Seattle, WA




Salary Range: The salary for this position is between $110K/year- $140K/Year. Factors that may affect pay within this range may include geography/market, skills, education, experience, and other qualifications of the successful candidate.

About Ascendion:

Ascendion is a full-service digital engineering solutions company. We make and manage software platforms and products that power growth and deliver captivating experiences to consumers and employees. Our engineering, cloud, data, experience design, and talent solution capabilities accelerate transformation and impact for enterprise clients. Headquartered in New Jersey, our workforce of 6,000+ Ascenders delivers solutions from around the globe. Ascendion is built differently to engineer the next.


Ascendion | Engineering to elevate life:

We have a culture built on opportunity, inclusion, and a spirit of partnership. Come, change the world with us:

  • Build the coolest tech for world’s leading brands
  • Solve complex problems - and learn new skills
  • Experience the power of transforming digital engineering for Fortune 500 clients
  • Master your craft with leading training programs and hands-on experience


Experience a community of change-makers!


Join a culture of high-performing innovators with endless ideas and a passion for tech. Our culture is the fabric of our company, and it is what makes us unique and diverse. The way we share ideas, learning, experiences, successes, and joy allows everyone to be their best at Ascendion.


About the Role:

Job Title: Data Engineer


Responsibilities

  • Develop, optimize, and maintain ETL pipelines using Glue.
  • Build and manage data workflows and orchestration using Managed Airflow (MWAA).
  • Write and optimize SQL and Python/PySpark scripts for data transformation and processing.
  • Work with data platforms such as Redshift and S3 for efficient data storage and retrieval.
  • Implement data cataloging and governance using Glue and Lake Formation.
  • Support reporting and analytics teams by ensuring data availability for QuickSight and Tableau.
  • Assist in automating infrastructure deployment using AWS CDK and Build Tools.
  • Monitor, troubleshoot, and optimize data pipelines for performance and reliability.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to understand data requirements and business objectives.


Minimum Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Data Engineering, or a related field.
  • 3-5+ years of experience in data engineering, ETL development, or similar roles.
  • Proficiency in AWS data technologies, including AWS Glue, Redshift, S3, and Lake Formation.
  • Strong programming skills in SQL, Python, and PySpark.
  • Experience with data pipeline orchestration using Managed Airflow (MWAA).
  • Familiarity with data modeling, warehousing concepts, and performance tuning.
  • Ability to work in an Agile development environment.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

  • Experience with AWS CDK and Build Tools for infrastructure automation.

Title: Sr. Data Analyst
Description:
Description

Take a leap and join our team!

At Gesa, we believe in the power of our people. Coming from all walks of life, our team members’ individual stories and unique experiences are our most valuable asset. But it’s how we come together, igniting our collective compassion and commitment to empowering our communities, that makes us succeed. Because we know we go further when we go together.

Here you can join a team who is passionate about serving others, has a desire to do good, and shares a deep love of people. You can engage in meaningful work that impacts your community. You can challenge yourself and grow in your career. And, you can rest assured that your wellbeing and prosperity are our priority.

Get to know us:

Role Summary:

Under the general supervision of the Data Integrity & Business Intelligence Manager/Team Leader, a Senior Data Analyst is responsible for supporting the business intelligence and data governance needs of the Credit Union. Primary duties shall include the maintenance and validation of the Credit Union’s data governance system, development of business intelligence tools, and creation of business intelligence reporting to meet the needs of stakeholders within the Credit Union to further their ability to make quality, data driven decisions. As a member of the Risk and Performance Team, a Senior Data Analyst will be an integral part of the ongoing strategic planning and monitoring process for the Credit Union.

What You Will Be Doing:


Act as a team lead within the Risk and Performance Department. Represent Risk and Performance in projects and committees as assigned.
Lead the development, maintenance, and support of accurate analytical models, Business Intelligence/reporting systems, and data warehouse solutions to meet the business intelligence needs of the Credit Union and its stakeholders.
Work with internal stakeholders to identify new reporting, dash boarding, and analytical opportunities in furtherance of the Credit Union’s business and strategic goals. Lead the implementation of identified opportunities and work with stakeholders to drive adoption.
Support the ongoing validation and maintenance of the Credit Union’s data sources in support of the Credit Union’s data governance framework.
Design, develop, and maintain the Credit Union’s Data Warehouse and other databases in furtherance of the business intelligence goals of the Credit Union.
Assist with various data validation, balancing, and business intelligence projects.
Develop and maintain business intelligence systems and capabilities that support the needs of a diverse group of Credit Union stakeholders. Lead the training of stakeholders throughout the organization on the Credit Union’s business intelligence systems.
Monitor indicators of performance and quality metrics and ensure compliance with data related policies, standards, roles and responsibilities, and adoption requirements. Provide suggestions for improved performance and adherence when appropriate.
Lead evaluations of the Credit Union’s quality control systems and report findings along with recommendations for improvements as needed.
Lead the training of new team members within the Credit Union’s Business Intelligence team with a focus on the tools and methods utilized by the team to accomplish their essential job functions.
Develop and maintain an expert level of knowledge regarding the Credit Union’s core operating systems, data warehouse solutions, and business intelligence systems and software solutions.
Identify and troubleshoot data-related problems and make maintenance or modification suggestions.
Assist with the Credit Union’s annual budgeting and forecasting processes along with other major Risk & Performance Team initiatives as assigned.
Must understand and perform Bank Secrecy Act (BSA) functions as applicable to job responsibilities.
Attend Credit Union training sessions, conferences, or seminars as approved by Management. Maintain awareness of policies and regulations related to duties and responsibilities.
Maintain and protect all sensitive data utilizing the highest standard of confidentiality and professionalism. Consistently display respect for all areas of diversity and levels of knowledge.
Display mutual respect, trust and dignity. Act in the best interest of the Credit Union; lead by example by displaying solid ethics and integrity at all times. Control risk and manage duties and tasks in a safe and sound manner.
Maintain a general knowledge of all Credit Union products and services, as well as the activities of departments.



About You:


Ability to maintain thorough knowledge of Credit Union business lines, processes, and products.
Strong analytical, quantitative, and modeling skills.
Ability to quickly grasp and adapt to changes in business models and new technologies.
Strong knowledge of relational databases, data mining techniques, and business intelligence tools.
Ability to write complex queries using tools such as SQL for reporting, analytics, and business intelligence.
Excellent interpersonal and listening skills.
Demonstrate commitment to continual process improvement.
Ability to work jointly and successfully in a team environment.
Able to successfully and professionally communicate both orally and in writing.
Able to prioritize tasks and projects with varying deadlines and priorities.



Qualifications

What You Will Need:


Four-year degree in Mathematics, Economics, Accounting, Finance, Data Analysis, Statistics; or equivalent training, coursework, and experience.
A minimum of eight years of similar or related experience; financial institution environment experience preferred.
High level of proficiency with business intelligence tools and large-scale data management.
Ability to interpret, validate, and balance large amounts of financial data with relative ease.
Proficient with standard office equipment, word processing and reporting.



Our Team Member Value Proposition:

In exchange for bringing your talent to Gesa, here are a just a few of the benefits and perks we offer:


Competitive Pay
Medical, Dental, Vision, and Life Insurance
20 days/year of Paid Time Off – Plus 10 Paid Holidays!
401(k) Match
Incentive Program
Tuition Assistance and Student Loan Repayment
Commuter Benefits
Paid Time Off to Volunteer in the Community
Product discounts
Engaging Work Environment
Rewards and Recognition Programs



Salary Range:

$97,915.62 - $146,873.43

Get wise to what’s possible with a career at Gesa. Join us!

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact the HR Department at (509) 378-3100 or hrmail@gesa.com to request an accommodation.

Gesa Credit Union reserves the right to revise or change the job description as the need arises. This job description is not all inclusive of total job responsibilities nor does it constitute a written or implied contract of employment.

Selected candidate(s) must be able to pass a pre-employment credit/background check.

Gesa Credit Union is an Equal Opportunity Employer and strong advocate of workforce diversity. Race/Color/Gender/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Religion/National Origin/Disability/Veteran.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
3Si is a software (SaaS) company that helps governments, nonprofits, and philanthropies use data to improve the lives of children. We work with a network of state and city governments to build data systems that help identify and address early childhood service gaps. Founded in 2012, 3Si is a mission driven organization with a collaborative, entrepreneurial, innovative, and fully remote work culture.




We are growing and seeking a mission driven Senior Data Analyst to join our Business Intelligence team. Ideal candidates will have exceptional technical, analytical and quantitative problem-solving skills, growth-mindset, and interest to make a positive impact.




This is a fully REMOTE position. Only applicants who currently reside in California, Colorado, Oregon, and Washington State will be considered for this role.




The Sr. Data Analyst plays a critical role in extracting, analyzing, and interpreting data to assist customers with use of the 3Si CUSP platform to provide valuable insights that contribute to informed decision making. This role will support workstreams that demand high-level quantitative skills to inform project data analyses and client data requests. This position works collaboratively across the organization and with external stakeholders.




What You Will Do

Contribute to the production of professional, thorough, rigorous analyses and outputs for clients and external stakeholders, including formal reports, presentations, and dashboards.
Design, build, and maintain flexible data models from various sources based on customer requests, including CUSP and other third-party sources, investigate and design integration and analytics.
Conduct data preparation tasks that include data inventory and assessments of data completeness and quality.
Conduct exploratory analysis of source data from clients and help architect integration across complex data systems in the implementation of CUSP products in client cloud environments.
Identify and address data discrepancies; troubleshoot data-quality issues, validate outputs, recommend, and implement process and performance improvements for data.
Analyze, synthesize, and communicate complex data-related issues to both internal colleagues and external clients.
Implement and draft "Analytics Snapshot" for monthly data report cards, including a specific analysis of clients' internal data or CUSP outputs. Write analytical narratives describing the analysis goals, methodology, findings, limitations, avenues for future analysis, relevance to clients.
Provide client management support by engaging and communicating with clients and contributing to client meetings. Ensure that deliverables are on time and client ready.
Collaborate with cross-functional team to understand data requirements and business needs; partner with engineering and product management teams in the implementation, operation and use of 3Si products for clients.
Stay current with industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in data analytics and visualization best practices and techniques.

Requirements

What You Will Bring

Bachelor’s degree or greater in a relevant field (e.g. Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Systems).
Five or more years’ experience in a consulting, research, data analytics, or similar.
Proficient with data analysis tools such as SQL, R, SPSS, Stata, SAS
Experience with at least one high-level programming language such as Python, Scala, Go
Experience in data modeling with relational and non-relational data
Significant experience designing and building data visualization solutions to customer requirements using data querying and visualization/reporting tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI)
Working knowledge of modern cloud-based data processing platforms such as Spark, Databricks, Snowflake, dbt
Familiarity with data science libraries such as NumPy, Pandas, Tensorflow
Proficiency in MS Office Suite required.
Strong consultative and project management skills
Solid ability to problem-solve and operate with analytical ambiguity.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to utilize multiple communication methods and styles to best reach target audience.
Exceptional organizational and time management skills.
Meticulous attention to detail to ensure accuracy in data analysis.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team-oriented environment.

3Si Perks

3Si offers a professional and fun work environment. We recognize and value our employees and strive to create a supportive environment for our team. Here are some of the "perks" we provide to ensure our employees can thrive:

Competitive compensation with base salary range of $115- 145K, plus annual bonus plan.
100% Company sponsored Medical, Dental, Vision, STD, EAP, and voluntary life/ad&d plans.
Paid Time Off starting at 3 weeks per year and 11 paid holidays.
401k retirement plan + match
Career development opportunities




3Si provides equal opportunity for all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), national origin, ancestry, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other basis protected by state or federal law.

Show more

  • 100% Company sponsored Medical, Dental, Vision, STD, EAP, and voluntary life/ad&d plans.
  • Paid Time Off starting at 3 weeks per year and 11 paid holidays.
  • 401k retirement plan + match

Title: Abuse Analyst, Trust and Safety, Messaging
Description:
Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Kirkland, WA, USA; Austin, TX, USA.Minimum qualifications:


Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience in data analysis, including identifying trends, generating statistics, and drawing insights from data.
Experience with data analysis and database management (e.g., SQL, Python, etc.).


Preferred qualifications:


Master's degree or equivalent practical experience.
8 years of experience working on signal development, data analysis, cyber security, or anti-abuse.
Experience with fraud/abuse investigations, fraud risk management, security and threat analysis in the context of internet, telephony, or communication-related products.
Experience with one or more languages: SQL, Python, Golang, including knowledge in Messaging (xMS/RCS) or SIM/Phone Number fraud and abuse.
Excellent communication and presentation skills to deliver findings to cross-functional partners, and the ability to influence cross-functionally at various levels.
Excellent problem-solving and critical thinking skills with attention to detail in a fluid environment.


About the jobIn this role, you will work globally and cross-functionally with Google Engineers and Product Managers to navigate challenging online safety situations and work on abuse and fraud at Google scale. You take satisfaction in knowing that every day you are working hard to promote trust in Google and ensuring the highest levels of user safety.At Google we work hard to earn our users’ trust every day. Trust & Safety is Google’s team of abuse fighting and user trust experts working daily to make the internet a safer place. We partner with teams across Google to deliver bold solutions in abuse areas such as malware, spam and account hijacking. A team of Analysts, Policy Specialists, Engineers, and Program Managers, we work to reduce risk and fight abuse across all of Google’s products, protecting our users, advertisers, and publishers across the globe in over 40 languages.

The US base salary range for this full-time position is $147,000-$216,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process.

Please note that the compensation details listed in US role postings reflect the base salary only, and do not include bonus, equity, or benefits. Learn more about benefits at Google .

Responsibilities


Analyze trends, conduct data analysis, and identify new signals to develop solutions for scaled enforcement.
Develop an understanding of abuse in messaging, current cross-product workflows, and available intelligence.
Work with cross-functional teams to design and build anti-abuse protections leveraging reputation at all levels (phone number, user, IP etc.), and advise on counter-abuse strategies. Also includes productionizing Machine Learning (ML) models.
Build dashboards to track abuse levels, perform quality checks to measure system/model reliability, and resolve false positives. Create awareness of threats and educate clients to reduce the problem upstream.
Lead projects to prevent Google's infrastructure from being abuse, harm or fraud, resulting in losses to users or Google. Collaborate cross-functionally to develop requirements based on data analysis and product understanding.



Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .
